item.title: Garden waste dumped in communal area next to private parking bay., 28th February
item.description:
There is a large amount of green waste that has been left in the communal parking area for over a year. These are thick tree branches that were cut and abandoned, and over time they have started to sprout and look like overgrown bushes. I want to clarify that this waste is not inside my parking space. It is located right next to it, almost touching my allocated bay, but clearly outside of my private area. This section of the parking area is communal, not private property of the neighbour. I am reporting it as fly‑tipping so the council can assess the situation and arrange removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westcott Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No parking/cars that are in one spot for weeks/months, 28th February
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally raise concerns regarding the worsening parking situation on Arcus Road, BR1. I have lived on this road for approximately 15 years and, regrettably, I have never known the parking conditions to be as problematic as they are at present. From around 3:00pm each afternoon through to the following morning, the road is completely saturated with vehicles. Cars are parked tightly along both sides of the road and increasingly on adjoining side roads, which significantly restricts visibility and safe passage. The level of congestion is now causing genuine safety concerns. Reduced sight lines make it difficult to see oncoming vehicles, pedestrians, or cyclists. As a single mother of two young children, this issue affects me particularly acutely. There are occasions when I am forced to park on neighbouring roads, often at some distance from my property. This is extremely challenging, especially when managing young children and shopping, and feels unsafe late in the evening. I also suffer from anxiety, and the constant worry about losing a nearby parking space has reached the point where I sometimes avoid using my car altogether for fear of not being able to park anywhere near my home upon return. I respectfully request that the Council investigates this matter as a priority. It may be appropriate to consider whether parking controls, permit schemes, time restrictions, or enforcement measures are required to alleviate the congestion and restore safe access for residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arcus Road, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
